title: Export Customers
text: The "Export Customers" feature enables you to export customer account data to an Excel spreadsheet format. This allows for convenient storage and analysis of customer information. Furthermore, you have the option to filter the list of customers based on specific fields within the table. This filtering capability allows you to refine the exported data and focus on particular subsets of customers based on your requirements. External Unique ID: The customer number used in the POS system. First Name: The customer's first name. Last Name: The customer's last name. Email: The customer's email address. Mobile Phone Number: The customer's mobile phone number. Phone Number: The customer's phone number. Associated Company (if applicable): The company associated with the customer, if applicable. Primary Billing Address: The customer's primary billing address. Primary Shipping Address: The customer's primary shipping address. Birthdate: The customer's birthdate. Language: The language preference of the customer. Currency: The currency preference of the customer. Credit Limit: The maximum amount that can be charged to the customer's account. Total Spent: A running total of all charges made to the customer's account (excluding off-account transactions). No. of Visits: The number of times a transaction has been completed with the customer's account linked via the customer widget. Loyalty Points: Currently Available: Loyalty points earned and available to spend. Not Yet Available: Loyalty points earned but not passed any qualifying period set in Loyalty Configuration. Total Used: Loyalty points that have been spent. Loyalty Points Currently Available (Converted): Points value converted to the customer account currency. Date Created: The date when the customer account was set up. Last Visit: The most recent time when the customer account was linked to a transaction.
description:
The "Export Customers" feature enables you to export customer account data to an Excel spreadsheet format. This allows for convenient storage and analysis of customer information.


Furthermore, you have the option to filter the list of customers based on specific fields within the table. This filtering capability allows you to refine the exported data and focus on particular subsets of customers based on your requirements.



  • External Unique ID: The customer number used in the POS system.
  • First Name: The customer's first name.
  • Last Name: The customer's last name.
  • Email: The customer's email address.
  • Mobile Phone Number: The customer's mobile phone number.
  • Phone Number: The customer's phone number.
  • Associated Company (if applicable): The company associated with the customer, if applicable.
  • Primary Billing Address: The customer's primary billing address.
  • Primary Shipping Address: The customer's primary shipping address.
  • Birthdate: The customer's birthdate.
  • Language: The language preference of the customer.
  • Currency: The currency preference of the customer.
  • Credit Limit: The maximum amount that can be charged to the customer's account.
  • Total Spent: A running total of all charges made to the customer's account (excluding off-account transactions).
  • No. of Visits: The number of times a transaction has been completed with the customer's account linked via the customer widget.
  • Loyalty Points:
    • Currently Available: Loyalty points earned and available to spend.
    • Not Yet Available: Loyalty points earned but not passed any qualifying period set in Loyalty Configuration.
    • Total Used: Loyalty points that have been spent.
    • Loyalty Points Currently Available (Converted): Points value converted to the customer account currency.
  • Date Created: The date when the customer account was set up.
  • Last Visit: The most recent time when the customer account was linked to a transaction.

title: Companies
Groups
text: Within Imagine, customers can be assigned to different customer groups. These customer groups serve as a means to categorize customers based on specific criteria. These customer groups can also be associated with promotional or discount offers within the Price and Promotion Engine (PPE) module. By linking customer groups to promotional offers, you can ensure that the discounts or promotions are automatically applied when qualifying items are added to a transaction. To trigger the promotional offers at the point of sale (POS), make sure to include a qualifying customer by utilizing the Find Customer widget. This will enable the system to identify the customer and automatically apply any relevant promotional offers associated with their assigned customer group. Creating a Customer Group To make a new customer group, click ‘CREATE NEW’. Enter an appropriate ‘Name’ for the customer group, then click ‘SAVE’. The group ‘ID’ will be assigned automatically and cannot be edited. Assign / Unassigned Group Members. Once the group is saved, group members can be assigned. In the ‘Unassigned’ search bar, enter either the first or last name of a customer. The list of matched results will be displayed below. Using the checkboxes, select the customers from the list. The checkbox in the column header next to ‘First Name’ will select all customers in the search results list. Click the blue button pointing to the ‘Assigned’ list. All selected customers will be moved to the ‘Assigned’ list. To remove a customer from a group, use the ‘Assigned’ search bar to locate the customer in the list. Use the checkbox to select the customer, then click the Red button pointing to the ‘Unassigned’ list. This will move the customer record from the ‘Assigned’ list to ‘Unassigned’. Click ‘SAVE’ in the top right corner of the page to save any changes to the customer group. Edit an Existing Group From the Customer Group list, select a group to be edited. Amend the following details as required: Group Name Group Members Click ‘SAVE’ in the top right corner of the page to save any changes to the customer group. To delete the group, use the ‘DELETE THIS GROUP’ button, then click on the orange confirmation message.
description:
Within Imagine, customers can be assigned to different customer groups. These customer groups serve as a means to categorize customers based on specific criteria.


These customer groups can also be associated with promotional or discount offers within the Price and Promotion Engine (PPE) module. By linking customer groups to promotional offers, you can ensure that the discounts or promotions are automatically applied when qualifying items are added to a transaction.


To trigger the promotional offers at the point of sale (POS), make sure to include a qualifying customer by utilizing the Find Customer widget. This will enable the system to identify the customer and automatically apply any relevant promotional offers associated with their assigned customer group.


Creating a Customer Group

To make a new customer group, click ‘CREATE NEW’.



Enter an appropriate ‘Name’ for the customer group, then click ‘SAVE’. The group ‘ID’ will be assigned automatically and cannot be edited.



Assign / Unassigned Group Members. Once the group is saved, group members can be assigned.



In the ‘Unassigned’ search bar, enter either the first or last name of a customer. The list of matched results will be displayed below.



Using the checkboxes, select the customers from the list. The checkbox in the column header next to ‘First Name’ will select all customers in the search results list.


Click the blue button pointing to the ‘Assigned’ list.

 


All selected customers will be moved to the ‘Assigned’ list.



To remove a customer from a group, use the ‘Assigned’ search bar to locate the customer in the list. Use the checkbox to select the customer, then click the Red button pointing to the ‘Unassigned’ list. This will move the customer record from the ‘Assigned’ list to ‘Unassigned’.


Click ‘SAVE’ in the top right corner of the page to save any changes to the customer group.



Edit an Existing Group

From the Customer Group list, select a group to be edited.



Amend the following details as required:

  • Group Name
  • Group Members

Click ‘SAVE’ in the top right corner of the page to save any changes to the customer group.



To delete the group, use the ‘DELETE THIS GROUP’ button, then click on the orange confirmation message.

title: Settings
text: To enable international E.164 phone number validation, follow these guidelines: When the feature is enabled: Phone numbers entered at the point of sale (POS) or in the Customer section must adhere to the E.164 standard. The phone number should start with a "+" symbol. The country code should consist of 1 to 3 digits. The subscriber number can have a maximum of 12 digits. Spaces are not allowed in the phone number. In the POS, the "+" symbol will be automatically added after the number is entered. When the feature is not enabled: The Phone Number field becomes a free-text field. The maximum character limit for the field is 20 characters. Enabling international E.164 phone number validation ensures that phone numbers follow the standard format and simplifies the validation process.
description:
To enable international E.164 phone number validation, follow these guidelines:


When the feature is enabled:

  • Phone numbers entered at the point of sale (POS) or in the Customer section must adhere to the E.164 standard.
  • The phone number should start with a "+" symbol.
  • The country code should consist of 1 to 3 digits.
  • The subscriber number can have a maximum of 12 digits.
  • Spaces are not allowed in the phone number.
  • In the POS, the "+" symbol will be automatically added after the number is entered.


When the feature is not enabled:

  • The Phone Number field becomes a free-text field.
  • The maximum character limit for the field is 20 characters.
  • Enabling international E.164 phone number validation ensures that phone numbers follow the standard format and simplifies the validation process.
